answer.explanation:
M-Cn: This is Sanjiv Roy calling from Riverbend Sporting Goods. I wanted to talk about the advertising campaign for our Pathbreaker backpack.
W-Am: Hi, Mr. Roy. Q1 We've made a lot of progress on the print advertisements, and they'll certainly be ready in time for the launch date on April first.
M-Cn: Actually, that's what I'm calling about. Q2 We've just learned that one of our competitors is releasing a similar product in April, so we want to start shipping the backpacks to stores sooner than that. Can you have the ads ready by March first instead?
(W-Am): I'll have to check with my project manager before I can confirm that. Q3 l speak with him after our call and see if he thinks that timeline is feasible.

question.text: What are the speakers mainly discussing?
choices: (A) The efficiency of a manufacturing process
(B) The timing of an advertising campaign
(C) The qualifications of a printing service
(D) The visual appeal of a product logo

answer.text: (B) The timing of an advertising campaign

question.text: Why does the man want to make a change?
choices: (A) He hopes to attract a different group of customers.
(B) A product has not been selling well.
(C) Customers have requested an updated model.
(D) A competitor plans to offer a similar item.

answer.text: (D) A competitor plans to offer a similar item.

question.text: What does the woman say she has to do next?

answer.explanation:
M-Cn: Hi, Q1 I'm looking for an exhibit that I read about in a newspaper article — the Marie Morris paintings?
W-Br: That collection is only here for three weeks, so it's in the special exhibits area on the second floor, just past the gift shop. You'll need a ticket for it.
M-Cn: Oh, Q2 I bought one online last week. It says I should enter between two and three o'clock.

(W-Br): Yes, Q3 you can only enter the exhibit at the time shown on your ticket. It's one forty-five right now, so you'll just have to wait fifteen more minutes.

question.text: What does the man ask about the exhibit?
How did the man get his ticket?
choices: (B)It was part of a tour package.
(C)He purchased it at the museum gift shop.

question.text: What does the woman say about the tickets?
choices: (B)They can be exchanged for a different exhibit.
(C)They are valid only for a specific time.

answer.text: (C)They are valid only for a specific time.

answer.explanation:
M-Au: Hello, this is Ian Kowalski from the personnel department. I just got into work, and Q1 when I tried to log on to my computer, my password was rejected.
W-Br: I’m sorry about that, Mr. Kowalski. The company updated its security protocols last night, and since then we've received a lot of calls about password problems. Q2 At this point, every member of the IT support team is working on one of those other requests so it may be several hours before one of them can call you back.
M-Au: That's OK. I'm leading a recruiting workshop at ten and it goes until noon, Q3 so I won't be back at my desk until twelve-thirty. Please call me then as I have another appointment at one o'clock.

question.text: What problem does the man report?
choices: (C) A computer file will not open.

question.text: What does the woman say about the support team?
choices: (B) They are in a training session.
(C) They are waiting for some replacement parts.
(D) They are busy helping other employees.

answer.text: (D) They are busy helping other employees.

question.text: When does the man ask the support team to call him?

answer.explanation:
W-Br: Hi, Pablo. I see you won't be in the office next week; are you going on holiday?
M-Au: Q1 Yes, Q1 I'm leaving on Monday to spend a week in Buenos Aires with my parents. I haven't seen them in a long time, so I'm really looking forward to the trip.
W-Br: Will you have enough time to prepare the opening speech for the shareholders' meeting? Q2 Remember, the meeting is two days after you get back. If you're too busy, I can ask Tom to do it.
M-Au: Don't worry. I'll be ready. Q3 I plan to finish writing it before I leave work tomorrow.

question.text: Why will the man be out of the office?
What does the woman offer to do?
What does the man say he will do before he leaves?

answer.explanation:
W-Br: Excuse me, Q1 a friend of mine booked her vacation here recently and recommended your agency. I'm thinking about going to the Bahamas in June and could use some help planning my trip.
M-Au: The Bahamas are a great place to vacation, but have you considered other destinations? Q2 There are some excellent deals on airfares to Florida right now, and the beaches are gorgeous. You could save a lot of money by traveling there instead.
W-Br: Hm, that's a good tip — I think I'd better talk it over with my family before I book anything.
M-Au: That's fine. Q3 Why don't you take a look at these brochures about Florida resort options? Some of these spots have special activities for families, so I think you'll be able to find something you like.

question.text: How did the woman find out about the travel agency?
choices: (A) Her company uses it for business travel.
(B) A friend told her about it.
(C) She saw a flyer in a store window.

answer.text: (B) A friend told her about it.

question.text: Why does the man suggest that the woman change her plans?
choices: (B) To ensure the best choice of accommodations
(C) To take advantage of lower prices
(D) To allow more time to research options

answer.text: (C) To take advantage of lower prices

question.text: What does the man offer the woman?

answer.explanation:
(M-Cn): Molly, did you reserve the main conference room so that we can rehearse our presentation for tomorrow's board meeting?
(W-Am): I thought I did but the room assignment sheet says that Stan's meeting with a client in there, so we'll have to find somewhere else to go.
(M-Cn): Well, why don't we practice in the second floor meeting room instead?

question.text: What are the speakers planning to do?
What does the woman say about the main conference room?
choices: (B) It does not have enough seats.
(C) It is on the first floor.

question.text: What does the man suggest?

answer.explanation:
W-Am: Jin, I just got Q1 a message from Ellen. She's having some car trouble and she won't be able to make it to work until later this morning.
M-Au: Oh, Q2 but she was supposed to spend this morning training the new front-desk staff. They're already here, waiting in the lobby. Could you take over for Ellen? I know she was planning to show them how to program wake-up calls for the guest rooms.
W-Am: Well, since I don't usually work at the front desk, I don't actually know how to do that. But Q3 I'd be happy to show them around the hotel until she gets here; we can see the business center, the gym, the dining rooms ... that'll take a couple of hours.

question.text: What does the woman say about Ellen?
choices: (A) She is in charge of the business center.
(B) She is planning to rent a car.
(C) She will be late for work today.
(D) She is waiting in the lobby.

answer.text: (C) She will be late for work today.

question.text: What does the man ask the woman to help with?
What will the woman probably do next?
choices: (C) Give a tour of a facility
(D) Return a key to a supervisor

answer.text: (C) Give a tour of a facility

answer.explanation:
Script:
W-Am: Hello, and thank you for calling Teresa's. How can I help you?
M-Au: Hi, Q1&2 I'd like to make a dinner reservation for five people at seven thirty tonight. My name's Lan Brason.
W-Am: Hmm, I can seat you in the dinning room at that time, or, if you don't mind waiting until eight o'clock, we can put you outside on the pitio. Which you prefer?
M-Au: Oh, in that case we'll wait. Q3 The weather has been so great this weekend, I'd prefer to sit outside.

question.text: Where does the woman most likely work?
Why is the man calling?
What is the man willing to wait for?

answer.explanation:
M-Au: Hi. Q1 I'm calling because I ordered a book from your bookstore's Web site last week, but I haven't received it. My confirmation number is 3467.
W-Br: OK, let me check our records. Q2 It looks like your order was for the paperback edition, but that won't be released for a couple of weeks. If you want the book now, I can send you the hardcover, but it costs 15 dollars more.
M-Au: Oh, I thought the paperback was already available. The thing is, I'm giving the book as a gift, so I really need it by the end of the week. Could you send me the hardcover instead?
W-Br: Certainly. And, to make sure you get it on time, Q3 I'd be happy to upgrade your order to express shipping, at no extra charge.

question.text: Why is the man calling?
choices: (A) To complain that he has been overcharged
(C) To check the status of an online order
(D) To report that a Web site description is incorrect

answer.text: (C) To check the status of an online order

question.text: What does the woman say about the paperback book?
choices: (B) It has been signed by the author.
(D) It is on sale this week.

question.text: What does the woman offer to do?
choices: (A) Put the man’s name on a waiting list

answer.explanation:
Script:
M-Cn: Jin-Sook, Q1 do you know how to get to Reynolds Square in the city center? I’m meeting a friend of mine there this evening.
W-Br: I think Q2 there’s a bus, but it makes a lot of stops. You know, actually, I have to drive to the city center. I’m going to run some errands after work.
M-Cn: Oh, OK, thanks, I appreciate it. That makes things a whole lot easier. Q3 You leave the office arround five o’clock, right?
W-Br: Q3 Yes, that’s right.

question.text: What is the man planning to do?
Why does the woman say, “I have to drive to the city centre”?
choices: (A) To express frustration with her schedule
(D) To offer the man a ride

answer.text: (D) To offer the man a ride
